functions.name: Math
functions.text: The math module defines extension functions to perform mathematical operations, such as pi, asin and acos. All functions are preceded by the math: prefix. Some of the functions have also been specified in the Functions and Operators Specification of the upcoming XQuery 1.1 Recommendation.

function.name: pi
function.summary: Returns the value of the mathematical constant π.
function.rule: This function returns the xs:double value whose lexical representation is 3.141592653589793.
function.example: The expression 60 * (math:pi() div 180) converts an angle of 60 degrees to radians.

function.name: e
function.summary: Returns the value of the mathematical constant e.
function.rule: This function returns the xs:double value whose lexical representation is 2.718281828459045.

function.name: sqrt
function.summary: Returns the square root of the argument.
function.rule: If $arg is the empty sequence, the function returns the empty sequence.
Otherwise the result is the xs:double value of the mathematical square root of $arg.

function.name: sin
function.summary: Returns the sine of the argument, expressed in radians.
function.rule: If $arg is the empty sequence, the function returns the empty sequence.
Otherwise the result is the sine of $arg, treated as an angle in radians.

function.name: cos
function.summary: Returns the cosine of the argument, expressed in radians.
function.rule: If $arg is the empty sequence, the function returns the empty sequence.
Otherwise the result is the cosine of $arg, treated as an angle in radians.

function.name: tan
function.summary: Returns the tangent of the argument, expressed in radians.
function.rule: If $arg is the empty sequence, the function returns the empty sequence.
Otherwise the result is the tangent of $arg, treated as an angle in radians.

function.name: asin
function.summary: Returns the arc sine of the argument.
function.rule: If $arg is the empty sequence, the function returns the empty sequence.
Otherwise the result is the arc sine of $arg, returned as an angle in radians in the range -π/2 to +π/2.

function.name: acos
function.summary: Returns the arc cosine of the argument.
function.rule: If $arg is the empty sequence, the function returns the empty sequence.
Otherwise the result is the arc cosine of $arg, returned as an angle in radians in the range 0 to +π.

function.name: atan
function.summary: Returns the arc tangent of the argument.
function.rule: If $arg is the empty sequence, the function returns the empty sequence.
Otherwise the result is the arc tangent of $arg, returned as an angle in radians in the range -π/2 to +π/2.

function.name: atan2
function.summary: Returns the arc tangent of the first argument divided by the second argument, the result being in the range -π/2 to +π/2 radians.
function.rule: If $arg1 is the empty sequence, the function returns the empty sequence.
Otherwise the result is the arc tangent of $arg1 divided by $arg2, returned as an angle in radians in the range -π to +π.

function.name: pow
function.summary: Returns the first argument raised to the power of the second argument.
function.rule: If $arg1 is the empty sequence, the function returns the empty sequence.
Otherwise the result is the $arg1 raised to the power of $arg2.

function.name: exp
function.summary: Returns e raised to the power of the argument.
function.rule: If $arg1 is the empty sequence, the function returns the empty sequence.
Otherwise the result is the value of e raised to the power of $arg.

function.name: log
function.summary: Returns the natural logarithm of the argument.
function.rule: If $arg1 is the empty sequence, the function returns the empty sequence.
Otherwise the result is the natural logarithm (base e) of $arg.

function.name: log10
function.summary: Returns the base 10 logarithm of the argument.
function.rule: If $arg1 is the empty sequence, the function returns the empty sequence.
Otherwise the result is the base 10 logarithm of $arg.

function.name: random
function.rule: This function returns a random xs:double value between 0.0 and 1.0.

function.name: sinh
function.summary: Returns the hyperbolic sine of the argument.
function.rule: If $arg is the empty sequence, the function returns the empty sequence.
Otherwise the result is the hyperbolic sine of $arg.

function.name: cosh
function.summary: Returns the hyperbolic cosine of the argument.
function.rule: If $arg is the empty sequence, the function returns the empty sequence.
Otherwise the result is the hyperbolic cosine of $arg.

function.name: tanh
function.summary: Returns the hyperbolic tangent of the argument.
function.rule: If $arg is the empty sequence, the function returns the empty sequence.
Otherwise the result is the hyperbolic tangent of $arg.
